title: Pete Doherty is banned from driving after getting caught speeding on the same camera FOUR times
text:
Pete Doherty has been banned from driving after the same speed camera caught him four times.

The Libertines singer blamed a broken dashboard light for three weeks of offences, saying it was dark each time and he could not see his speed, in a 30mph zone.

The musician muttered 'ouch' on receipt of his six-month ban and £9,200 fine.

The Libertines singer, 40, pictured outside Folkestone Magistrates' Court. He received a six-month ban and £9,200 fine

Folkestone magistrates heard the 40-year-old had been caught in Cliftonville, Kent – a mile from his new hotel in Margate.

He was driving a 13-year-old VW Transporter van at 40mph last New Year's Eve, and 38mph five days later. On January 6 he was flashed at 36mph – the same as the final offence on January 20.

Doherty, (pictured performing) who earns £10,000 a month, told the magistrates that he expects to return to court soon having recently been on an electric scooter

Each of the four offences cost the former Babyshambles singer £100 and three points. But the additional points brought the total on his licence to 21.

Doherty, who earns £10,000 a month, told the magistrates that he expects to return to court soon having recently been on an electric scooter.

'I drove it down by the beach and was pulled over,' he said. 'They gave me a notice.'

Magistrate Andrew Henderson told Doherty he is banned from 'piloting any propelled vehicle on British highways for six months. That includes this scooter.'
description: The Libertines singer blamed a broken dashboard light for three weeks of offences, saying it was dark each time and he could not see his speed in the 30mph zone in Cliftonville, Kent.
